data.title: Tony Butterfield, Stephanie Farrell, and Gayle Gibson: Doing a World of Good
data.meta_description: In this episode, you'll meet Tony Butterfield, Stephanie Farrell, and Gayle Gibson, three of our members focused on raising awareness, offering support, and creating dialog for issues relevant to LGBTQ+ individuals within our profession.
data.text:
In this episode of the Foundationâ€™s Doing a World of Good podcast, you'll meet Tony Butterfield, Stephanie Farrell, and Gayle Gibson, three of our members spearheading an initiative focused on LGBTQ+ & Allies, a program that is designed to raise awareness, offer support, and create dialog for issues relevant to Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer or Questioning individuals within our profession.

Tony Butterfield is an engineering professor at the University of Utah.

Stephanie Farrell is the Founding Chair of Experiential Engineering at Rowan University and the 2018-2019 President of The American Society for Engineering Education.

Gayle Gibson is the now retired former head of Engineering at DuPont.

In the podcast, Tony, Stephanie, and Gayle discuss the immediate and long-term goals of AIChE's LGBTQ+ initiative and members can get involved, how new expectations to advance inclusion will change definitions of leadership, and how this initiative will impact their students and mentees as they consider their own career choices in engineering.

Learn more about the Doing a World of Good Campaign.

Visit https://www.aiche.org/LGBTQAnnual2018 to learn about LGBTQ+ & Allies Inclusion in Engineering Session at the 2018 Annual Meeting

Listen to AIChE-Doing a World of Good No. 11 with Tony Butterfield, Stephanie Farrell, and Gayle Gibson using the audio player below or subscribe below.
